item.title: Instructor Notes
item.description:
Questions

After completing the lab recap as a class the following questions:

General Discussion Questions

PCF Metrics is very much in its early stages (it is still labeled a beta). So don’t oversell its capabilities.

It is known that right now it doesn’t help you pinpoint exactly where the problem is but further iterations (release of the product) will be moving towards more integrated views, such as including logs for a specific point in time and support for individual instances (at present everything is aggregated/averaged).

Questions From the Lab

Q: What might a spike in memory indicate?
A: A spike in memory might mean a resource leak in the code.

Troubleshooting

Troubleshooting guidance for the lab that instructors need to know.

Feedback

Please keep track of all types of feedback, so that we can make this module great. That includes questions that students may ask that we should be answering up front, lab corrections/improvements, etc.

Submit feedback to: pcf-developer-instructor-feedback@pivotal.io

item.title: Metrics
item.description:
Estimated Time: 25 minutes

Requirements

Lab Requirements

What you will learn

  • How to access PCF Metrics
  • How to use PCF Metrics to better understand how your application is performing

Exercises

PCF Metrics Overview

Pivotal Cloud Foundry

1) Review the documentation on PCF Metrics.

Pivotal Web Services

1) Review the documentation on PCF Metrics.

Explore PCF Metrics

1) Log into PCF Metrics and explore the views for articulate.

2) Generate some traffic to articulate and observe the effects.

Optionally use the JMeter script from the Application Autoscaler lab to generate some traffic.

Questions

  • What might a spike in memory indicate?
